name: Bergamot
description: A bright, citrusy scent with subtle floral undertones, native to Calabria, Italy. Known for its refreshing and uplifting properties.
fun_fact: Bergamot is what gives Earl Grey tea its distinctive flavor
extraction: Cold-pressed from the peel of the fruit

name: Lavender
description: A sweet, floral-herbaceous scent beloved for its calming and soothing properties. Primary cultivation in Provence, France.
fun_fact: The word lavender comes from the Latin 'lavare' meaning 'to wash'

name: Cinnamon
description: A warm, spicy aroma derived from tree bark, adding depth and warmth to fragrances. Primarily sourced from Sri Lanka.
fun_fact: True cinnamon is different from cassia, which is commonly sold as cinnamon in many countries

name: Frankincense
description: A rich, complex woody-spicy scent with deep spiritual significance. Harvested from Boswellia trees in Yemen and Oman.
fun_fact: Has been traded in the Arabian Peninsula and North Africa for over 5000 years
extraction: Steam distillation of dried tree resin

name: Amber
description: A warm, rich accord created from labdanum, vanilla, and other resins. Historical origins in Baltic region.
fun_fact: Unlike most ingredients, amber in perfumery is a created accord, not a natural substance
extraction: Blend of natural and synthetic materials

name: Agarwood
description: A deep, woody scent also known as oud, produced by Aquilaria trees when infected with mold. Highly valued in Middle Eastern perfumery.
fun_fact: Often called 'liquid gold' due to its high value - can be more expensive than gold by weight

name: Tonka Beans
description: A sweet, vanilla-like scent with hints of cherry, almond, and cinnamon. Sourced primarily from South America.
fun_fact: Contains coumarin, one of the first synthetic materials used in perfumery

name: Vanilla
description: A sweet, warm, and comforting scent derived from vanilla pods. Madagascar produces some of the world's finest vanilla.
fun_fact: It takes 3-4 years before a vanilla orchid produces beans

name: Damask Rose
description: The queen of flowers in perfumery, known for its rich, honeyed, and spicy-floral scent. Bulgarian roses are considered the finest in the world.
fun_fact: It takes about 4,000 kg of rose petals to make 1 kg of rose oil
extraction: Steam distillation of petals or solvent extraction

name: Sandalwood
description: A soft, creamy woody scent with subtle sweet notes. Indian sandalwood is considered the most prestigious variety.
fun_fact: A sandalwood tree must be at least 15 years old before harvesting
